info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:14PM EDT until July 20 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MERCER AND SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO COUNTIES... At 813 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles north of Grove City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Clintonville, Kennerdell, and Barkeyville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
